alert.note: Alert for Lafayette (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 09 at 10:57PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Lafayette County through 1145 PM EST... At 1057 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Mayo, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mayo, Grady and Alton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
